com.cyc.km.query.construction

Class QuerySearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.km.query.construction.QuerySearch

  • public class QuerySearch
extends Object
    QuerySearch is a class encapsulating the parameters and results of the process of searching for Queries based on an NL string. Terms that may be mentioned in the string are identified, and generally small "fragment" queries using them are constructed. The results can be combined interactively to construct a query corresponding to the overall input string.

    Query searches are performed within the context of a CycBasedTask, which defines filters, etc., to guide the search results to task-relevant terms.

    See Also:
    Query

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuerySearch

        public QuerySearch(String searchString,
           CycBasedTask task)
        Creates a new query search with the specified search string and task.
        Parameters:
        searchString - A natural language string (usually a question or other sort of request for information)
        task - Provides the context for interpreting searchString as a set of queries.

      • QuerySearch

        public QuerySearch(String searchString,
           CycBasedTask task,
           QuerySearch.VariableFormat format)
        Creates a new query search with the specified search string, task, and variable format.
        Parameters:
        searchString - A natural language string (usually a question or other sort of request for information)
        task - Provides the context for interpreting searchString as a set of queries.
        format - The QuerySearch.VariableFormat used for queries constructed by the search.

    • Method Detail

      • getTask

        public CycBasedTask getTask()
        Returns the task associated with this search.
        Returns:
        the task associated with this search.

      • getSearchString

        public String getSearchString()
        Returns the search string associated with this search.
        Returns:
        the string for which matching queries are sought.

      • getTerms

        public Collection<KBObject> getTerms()
        Returns the terms identified in the search string. The results are filtered and focused based on the CycBasedTask associated with this search.

        Unlike getQueries(), the results of this search need to be incorporated into queries, e.g. by constructing Sentence objects.

        Returns:
        the terms identified in the search string.
        See Also:
        getTask()

      • getSituatedTerms

        public Map<KBObject,Collection<Span>> getSituatedTerms()
        Returns a Map mapping terms identified in the search string to the Spans where they were found. Each Map.Entry can be considered a situated term, combining the KBObject with its location information.
        Returns:
        the map
        See Also:
        getTerms()

      • getTermLocations

        public Collection<Span> getTermLocations(KBObject term)
        Returns the locations of the specified term in the search string.
        Parameters:
        term - A term identified in the search string.
        Returns:
        the locations
        See Also:
        getTerms().

      • getQueries

        public Collection<Query> getQueries()
        Returns the Queries identified with the search string. The results are filtered and focused based on the CycBasedTask associated with this search.

        Unlike getTerms(), the results of this search are full-fledged queries that can be run, although they typically must be combined via Query.merge(com.cyc.query.Query) to cover the full meaning of the input string.

        Returns:
        the queries found in the search string.

      • getQueryLocations

        public Collection<Span> getQueryLocations(Query query)
        Returns the locations of a Query identified with the search string.
        Parameters:
        query - A particular Query that was found somewhere in this QuerySearch
        Returns:
        start, end indices for locations of query in search string.

      • getSituatedQueries

        public Map<Query,Collection<Span>> getSituatedQueries()
        Returns a Map mapping queries identified in the search string to the Spans where they were found. Each Map.Entry can be considered a situated query, combining the KBObject with its location information.
        Returns:
        the map
        See Also:
        getQueries()
